channel.title: Downloading a SWF to your comp off the internet; "Permanent Flash Hacking"
channel.description:
While this is easy, I will also explain an upside to it. I haven't done this in a very long time (as far as the editing thing), so I'll be learning as I teach :P
Sadly we have to use the virus filled, spyware infested, malware mall of all browsers, Firefox... lol just kidding, Internet Explore :eek: :|
Steps: 1. First of all you need to find you swf file. These are FunnyJunk, AlbinoBlackSheep, eBaums World etc.. videos and games and what not.
2. When you find the file you want, in IE, go to Tools > Internet Options
3. A small box pops up, which is actually very helpful. If your not already on the General Tab... click it ;)
4. Now hit Delete Files, click All Offline Content, and press OK
[img]http://img412.imageshack.us/img412/2161/deletefileswe7.png[/img]
5. Go to the page in Internet Explore with the movie/game you want
6. Let it load completely
7. Again, Tools > Internet Options
8. This time hit Settings
[img]http://img244.imageshack.us/img244/1310/internetoptions01fz2.png[/img]
9. Now View Files
10. OK, within the tons of 'cookie@blablabla..' lies the file you want. Just scroll all the way down.
[img]http://img95.imageshack.us/img95/4314/tempfilescm5.png[/img]
11. Look for the swf symbol [img]http://img261.imageshack.us/img261/117/swfsymbolso5.png[/img]
12. It might have a bunch of random numbers, or something close to the name of what ever your getting.
13. It will say Flash Movie
14. To make sure, check the URL, it should have the website name on it.
15. Drag the file out of the Temp ben into what ever destination (Desktop, My Documents, A personal folder etc..)
16. Right click - rename Game.swf
That's it :rolleyes: [sup] This[/sup] is [sub]extra[/sub]
This part of the tut is to play around with the coding of the game. GAME ONLY
Download [url=http://www.nowrap.de/download/flasm16win.zip]Flasm[/url]
This is where I get fuzzy, lets play around with it anyway.. I will also not make this very understandable as I have no idea what I'm talking about, I'm in a rush, tired, and have some 'big' tests at school tomorrow (like I give a shit :P) [u][i] EDIT: Did those tests, easy peezy lemon squezy [/i][/u]
Extract Flasm (to My Documents works)
Open the windows command prompt
Copy the flasm folder
Paste it
Copy the game.swf we made
Paste it into the copied flasm folder
Rename the copied flasm folder to GameEdit
Rename the swf to game
This is what you should have [img]http://img87.imageshack.us/img87/1156/foldernowkoj3.png[/img] inside the copied flasm folder
Now get the source (location of the file), it says Address
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/600/adressom1.png[/img]
[sup]footnote 1[/sup]
Now in the command prompt type [code]cd[/code] "space" (a space, not type space lol) and then everything that's in the address bar (this just makes it simpler for newer people)
Press enter
OkieDokie now your in the folder
Type flasm.exe [sup] endoffootnote1[/sup]
Now type [code]flasm -d game.swf > foo.flm[/code]
z0mGGgg!1!!1 U R Gawt t3H code filez1!1!!
lol
Basically now you've disassembled the coding to the swf (Flash for slow people..) file
Now in the GameEdit folder, we have a text file called foo.flm or just foo or what ever, open it. If it asks for what program, use NotePad or WordPad or what ever basic text editor you have.
I've played around with games over 10MB of coding (StickArena for example (That's a hackpack)), and if your averaging at over 5MB, you have a decent game. From here search simple stuff.
Ex> speed
Keep searching it until you get to numbers and such. This would be the speed of your char or what ever, it's usually labeled. So search until you find what you want, you can change ammo, life, all that bla bla.. I'm not getting too far into it just the basics. You can even change some text, like strings, as they are variables, which are coding, which are really the Flash part (the ActionScript)
Other Examples> ammo health stamina strength
Before I get way too into this, I'd like to stop :P
When you've done your change, save foo.flm (ctrl + s just to make it easier), bring the command prompt back up (if you closed it, do [sup]footnote1[/sup] to [sup]endoffootnote1[/sup], just scroll up a bit.
Now that you have your edited code saved, your still in your file in the Command Prompt with flasm on, type [code]flasm -a foo.flm[/code]
It should say "foo.flm successfully assembled to game.swf, # bytes"
Your Done :D Run your game and the effects should be working
Post back any problems
[u][i][b]Could I get a rate on the over all tut and if it actually helped?[/b][/i][/u]
Note: Doing this would make you a 'hacker', as this is editing code to get something to work for YOU
Another note: This is kind of like Mvp's tut, except permanent because it's in the coding.

item.title: Downloading a SWF to your comp off the internet; "Permanent Flash Hacking"
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

I have a much easier way of doing this…its called
Sothink SWF Decompiler

You can also use it to “Export Resources” from the flash file.
Example: the games music, images etc.

Screenshot:

Also for just downloading the .swf files use this for Firefox:
Sothink SWF Catcher for Firefox

When a .swf is loading in your browser, a window pops up asking if you would like to download it, much easier.

There. I completely rewrote this tutorial with 2 programs.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxhellfirexx xxhellfirexx
item.description:
@xxhellfirexx wrote:

Alright I was just constantly modifying the flash code to try to escape the encryption. The flash game maker even said it was encrypted. However than I slammed into a wall as I believe I almost go it as the link to the flash file is :
C:\Documents and Settings\Cheryl\Desktop\flashcircle.swf
but when I load the modified flash game firefox opens and gives me this:
Firefox can’t find the file at /C:/Documents and Settings/Cheryl/Desktop%0Clashcircle.swf.
Anyone know how to fix the link so the game actually loads?

Read full topic

The batch and wget.exe must be in the same folder. If they are it should just work. Nevermind lol

item.title: Downloading a SWF to your comp off the internet; "Permanent Flash Hacking"
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

Thats because you opened the wrong file. you open the batch file. If you dont trust me google it and downoad it. I only posted it because i included a batch file for newbies who dont really understand these things…

Edit: I also reccommend that when you extract flasm that you extract to the root of your hard drive eg. c:/flasm
Then it will be there for future use

then when your in cmd type
cd C:/flasm

cd means “current directory” I think? It just means cmd will have c:/flasm as the default directory

Read full topic

item.title: Downloading a SWF to your comp off the internet; "Permanent Flash Hacking"
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

^^ you are partially right, like i can't remember what, but some of the maker (can't think of the name)
[b]XGen Studios[/b]
of SA have a security code in them, that doesn't let you play if the game is not on their server, i know this cause i was big into hackign flash games a year or so ago, i found a way around it, but it was harder then i would have thought :( but like stick arena, i think that would be much harder because its multiplayer
[b]When you look at the .flm file you search [/b][code]'piracy action..'[/code][b] or something to that matter. Then take out that code and what not.[/b]
, so what you could do i guess is use IE, then go to your temp interent files find the game (i think that it would be saved there, could be wrong, there are still other ways to do it this way even it their not) then open that with sothink swf decompiler, and edit it to your hearts content...
[b]That was my whole tutorial[/b]
like in my cheat pack i made for SA, i can't remember how i did it, if i had the code i probably would, but i did stuff like if you press F5, you could go through walls, and if you press F6, you get x weapon, and F7 for y weapon, etc... it was cool,
[b]That's what I was workin on[/b]
i think they can detect it a lot easier now though, i could be wrong, havent played in ages
[b]They can't detect it at all[/b]

Not to break down your post or anything, just answering your questions

Read full topic
